subject: Religion & Spirituality
title: Christian Nationalism: Faith as Politics
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Christian Nationalism: Faith as Politics.

hook.text: America was founded as a Christian nation. At least, that's the claim. History tells a more complicated story.

buildup.text: Christian nationalists argue America's laws should reflect Christian values. They see secularism as an attack on faith.

discovery.text: The Founders were a mix of Christians, deists, and skeptics. Jefferson cut miracles from his own Bible.

twist.text: Christian nationalism is growing globally. Brazil, Hungary, and India blend religion with identity politics.

climax.text: When faith becomes a political weapon, it stops being about God. It becomes about power wearing a religious costume.

punchline.text: Christian nationalism uses faith as a weapon. It's about power, not prayer.

quiz.question: What is Christian nationalism?
options: A political movement that wants national law to reflect Christian values
